channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tit for tat: House censures are becoming 'snap' solutions
item.description: Long reserved for weighty misconduct, the censure in the House has shifted into a rapid-fire tactic, as legislators use it tit-for-tat.

item.title: Jamie Dimon says Trump’s efficiency drive isn’t enough to avert debt crisis: ‘Like most problems, it’s better to deal with it than let it happen’
item.description: Dimon stressed that only faster growth—unlocked by lighter regulation and freer trade—can restore balance to the U.S.’s debt-to-GDP ratio.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg says he wants to ‘stay out of partisan politics’
item.description: Just weeks ago, Zuckerberg sat next to Trump at a White House dinner and pledged to invest $600 billion in the U.S. over the next four years.

item.title: The Wrong Tool for Protecting Women from Abortion
item.description: There is no reliable evidence that prosecuting women would lead to the elimination of abortion.

item.title: The Fed Should Do One Thing — and One Thing Only
item.description: We don’t want a Democratic Fed or a Republican Fed. We want an American Fed.

item.description: 'For this really to stick, it is not emotion that's going to win the day. It's the message of the gospel, which will not change.'

item.title: We Can Smash Antifa Without Designating Them
